comments.title: Typical Exterior Wear
comments.body: Typical cosmetic wear was observed on the exterior surfaces. These conditions are common in previously owned homes and are not considered significant defects.

comments.title: Damaged Siding
comments.body: Damaged exterior siding was observed at (location). Repair or replacement of the affected areas is recommended to help protect the structure from moisture intrusion.

comments.title: Missing Siding
comments.body: Areas of missing or incomplete siding were observed at (location). This should be repaired to protect underlying materials from weather exposure.

comments.title: Gaps at Exterior
comments.body: Gaps were observed at exterior joints and penetrations at (location). Caulking or sealing is recommended to help reduce moisture intrusion and air leakage.

comments.title: Deteriorated Mortar Joints
comments.body: Areas of deteriorated or missing mortar were observed in the masonry at (location). Repointing by a qualified mason is recommended to help prevent water entry and further deterioration.

comments.title: Paint Maintenance Needed
comments.body: Exterior painted surfaces at (location) show signs of weathering and could benefit from paint maintenance. Proper painting helps protect wood and other materials from moisture damage.

comments.title: Exterior Wood Rot
comments.body: Areas of rot were observed in exterior wood components at (location). Damaged material should be repaired or replaced as needed to restore structural integrity and prevent further deterioration.

comments.title: Missing J-Channel
comments.body: J-channel or trim flashing around the exterior cladding is missing or incomplete at (location). Installation of proper trim is recommended to help shed water and protect wall assemblies.

comments.title: Typical Eave Wear
comments.body: Typical weathering was observed at the eaves, soffits, and fascias. No significant deficiencies were noted unless otherwise described in this report.

comments.title: Damaged Fascia
comments.body: Damaged or deteriorated fascia boards were observed at (location). Repairs are recommended to help protect roof edges and prevent moisture intrusion.

comments.title: Eave/Soffit Rot
comments.body: Rot or deterioration was observed at the eaves/soffits at (location). Repairs are recommended to restore proper protection of roof and wall assemblies.

comments.title: Soffit Vents Blocked
comments.body: Soffit vents at (location) appear to be blocked or covered. Clearing or improving venting is recommended to allow proper attic ventilation.

comments.title: Paint Maintenance at Eaves
comments.body: Peeling or worn paint was observed at the eaves/soffits/fascias. Scraping, priming, and repainting will help protect these components from deterioration.

comments.title: Gaps at Exterior Door
comments.body: Gaps were observed around the exterior door at (location). Weatherstripping or adjustment is recommended to improve sealing and energy efficiency.

comments.title: Exterior Door Trim Damaged
comments.body: Damaged or deteriorated exterior trim was noted around the door at (location). Repairs and sealing are recommended to help prevent moisture intrusion.

comments.title: Factory Primer Needs Paint
comments.body: The exterior door at (location) appears to have only a factory primer coat. A proper finish coat of paint is recommended to reduce the likelihood of rust and weather damage.

comments.title: Door Hinges Oriented Outward
comments.body: The exterior door at (location) is installed with the hinges facing outward. This is a security concern because hinge pins can be removed from the exterior. Reinstallation or hardware changes are recommended for improved security.

comments.title: Window Trim Rot
comments.body: Rot or deterioration was observed at the exterior window trim/sills at (location). Repairs are recommended to protect the structure from water intrusion.

comments.title: Window Caulking Needed
comments.body: Gaps or failed caulking were observed around the exterior window at (location). Re-caulking is recommended to help prevent moisture intrusion.

comments.title: Storm Door Needs Adjustment
comments.body: The exterior storm door at (location) does not fully close or seal properly. Adjustment or minor repair is recommended.

comments.title: Storm Door Glass Cracked
comments.body: Glass in the storm door at (location) is cracked or damaged. Repair or replacement is recommended for safety and weather protection.

comments.title: Typical Driveway Cracks
comments.body: Typical cracking and surface wear were observed in the driveway. These conditions are common and generally considered cosmetic unless otherwise noted.

comments.title: Driveway Settlement
comments.body: Areas of settlement or unevenness were observed in the driveway at (location). These areas should be monitored and repairs may be desirable for appearance, drainage, or to reduce trip hazards.

comments.title: Driveway Trip Hazard
comments.body: A raised or displaced section of the driveway at (location) presents a potential trip hazard. Grinding, leveling, or replacement is recommended for safety.

comments.title: Gravel Driveway Grading
comments.body: The gravel driveway at (location) could be better graded to provide a more even surface and direct water away from structures.

comments.title: Typical Walkway Cracks
comments.body: Typical cracking and surface wear were observed in the walkways. These conditions are common and generally cosmetic unless otherwise noted.

comments.title: Walkway Trip Hazard
comments.body: A raised or settled section of the walkway at (location) presents a trip hazard. Repair or leveling is recommended for safety.

comments.title: Walkway Section Missing or Removed
comments.body: A section of walkway at (location) is missing or has been removed, creating an uneven surface. Repairs are recommended to provide a safer walking surface.

comments.title: Typical Porch/Deck Wear
comments.body: Typical wear and weathering were observed at the porch/deck/patio surfaces. No significant deficiencies were noted unless otherwise described.

comments.title: Loose Railings
comments.body: Loose or wobbly railings were observed at the porch/deck at (location). Secure repair is recommended for safety.

comments.title: Damaged or Loose Deck Boards
comments.body: Damaged, loose, or deteriorated deck/porch boards were observed at (location). Repairs or replacement of affected boards is recommended.

comments.title: Porch Brick Mortar Openings
comments.body: Openings in the mortar joints were observed at the porch structure (location). Repointing and sealing are recommended to help limit moisture entry and deterioration.

comments.title: Porch Understructure Moisture
comments.body: Evidence of moisture staining or corrosion was observed in the area below the porch at (location). This area should be monitored and repairs made if active leakage is confirmed.

comments.title: Typical Garage Wear
comments.body: Typical cosmetic wear was observed in the garage/carport. No significant deficiencies were noted unless otherwise stated.

comments.title: Garage Door Trim Damaged
comments.body: Exterior trim around the garage door opening at (location) is damaged or deteriorated. Repairs and sealing are recommended to help prevent further moisture-related damage.

comments.title: Garage Service Door Difficult to Lock
comments.body: The exterior service door at the garage (location) is difficult to lock or latch. Adjustment or minor repair is recommended for proper operation and security.

comments.title: Garage OSB Exposed near Grade
comments.body: Oriented strand board (OSB) or other non-durable sheathing was observed exposed near grade in the garage at (location). This material is not designed for continuous exterior exposure and should be protected or replaced as needed.

comments.title: Typical Lot Drainage
comments.body: Lot grading and drainage around the home appeared generally adequate at the time of inspection, with no significant standing water observed.

comments.title: Negative Grading Towards House
comments.body: Areas of negative or flat grading were observed adjacent to the foundation at (location). Regrading to slope soil away from the home is recommended to help reduce the potential for water intrusion.

comments.title: Surface Water Flow Concern
comments.body: The lot configuration and hard surfaces suggest that significant water may flow toward the home or entry at (location) during heavy rain. Installation or improvement of drains or swales may be desirable.

comments.title: Drainage at Exterior Door Landing
comments.body: Drainage near the exterior door landing at (location) appears inadequate to handle surface water. Improving drainage (for example, by adding or upgrading a drain) is recommended to help reduce water intrusion risk.

comments.title: Retaining Wall Typical Wear
comments.body: Typical cracking, staining, or movement was observed in the retaining wall at (location). No urgent deficiencies were noted unless otherwise described.

comments.title: Retaining Wall Leaning or Bowing
comments.body: The retaining wall at (location) shows signs of leaning, bowing, or displacement. While no recent movement can be confirmed during a one-time inspection, evaluation by a qualified contractor may be desirable, especially if movement continues.

comments.title: Retaining Wall Cracking
comments.body: Cracking was observed in the retaining wall at (location). Cracks should be monitored for enlargement, and repairs may be needed if movement continues or if water penetration becomes an issue.

comments.title: Retaining Wall Drainage
comments.body: It is not clear whether the retaining wall at (location) has adequate drainage provisions. Poor drainage can contribute to movement or failure over time. Further evaluation or improvements may be desirable.

comments.title: Vegetation Too Close to House
comments.body: Vegetation is growing close to, or in contact with, the exterior walls or roof at (location). Trimming or removal is recommended to help prevent damage and improve airflow.

comments.title: Fence Typical Wear
comments.body: Typical wear and weathering were observed on the fencing. No significant deficiencies were noted unless otherwise described.

comments.title: Fence Damaged or Leaning
comments.body: Sections of fence at (location) are damaged, leaning, or loose. Repairs may be desirable for appearance, security, or pet containment.

comments.title: Random Post Trip Hazard
comments.body: A lone post or stake in the yard at (location) presents a potential trip hazard. Removal or clear marking is recommended.

comments.title: Animal Burrow or Erosion Near Foundation
comments.body: An animal burrow or erosion was observed near the foundation or exterior wall at (location). This area should be monitored and backfilled or otherwise repaired as needed to prevent further settlement or pest activity.

comments.title: Typical Step Wear
comments.body: Typical wear was observed at the exterior steps. No significant deficiencies were noted unless otherwise stated.

comments.title: Loose Handrail
comments.body: The handrail at the steps (location) is loose or not well secured. Repair is recommended for safety.

comments.title: Broken or Loose Step Tread
comments.body: A damaged or loose step tread was observed at (location). Repair or replacement is recommended to reduce the risk of injury.

comments.title: Handrail Recommended
comments.body: A handrail was not present at the steps at (location). Installing a secure handrail is recommended for improved safety.

comments.title: Exterior Limited by Snow/Vegetation
comments.body: Portions of the exterior were obscured by snow, vegetation, stored items, or finishes and could not be fully inspected.

comments.title: Exterior Limited by Weather
comments.body: Weather conditions at the time of inspection limited evaluation of some exterior components. Areas should be monitored during different weather conditions.

comments.title: Outbuildings Limited Evaluation
comments.body: Outbuildings and detached structures received a limited inspection focusing on major visible defects. Cosmetic issues and minor maintenance items may not be noted individually.

comments.title: Outbuilding Typical Wear
comments.body: Typical wear and weathering were observed at the outbuilding(s). No significant deficiencies were noted unless otherwise described.

comments.title: Exterior Maintenance Tip
comments.body: Ongoing exterior maintenance, including paint, caulking, and prompt repair of minor defects, is important to help protect the structure from moisture intrusion and extend the life of exterior materials.
